    Celerity in the `lorentz` package

Photons

photon.Rd

Various functionality to deal with the 4-momentum of a photon

Usage

is.consistent.nullvec(N,TOL=1e-10)
as.photon(x,E=1)

Arguments

N

Four-momentum to be tested for nullness

TOL

tolerance

x

Vector of three-velocities

E

Energy, a scalar

Details

Returns the four-momentum of a photon.

Author

Robin K. S. Hankin

See also

4mom,reflect

Examples


## A bunch of photons all approximately parallel to the x-axis:
as.photon(as.3vel(cbind(0.9,runif(10)/1000,runif(10)/1000)))
#>       E       p_x          p_y          p_z
#>  [1,] 1 0.9999999 0.0001367530 0.0003977735
#>  [2,] 1 0.9999989 0.0010684742 0.0010028358
#>  [3,] 1 0.9999995 0.0009514986 0.0001333210
#>  [4,] 1 0.9999999 0.0000494103 0.0004958587
#>  [5,] 1 0.9999994 0.0010511556 0.0003988674
#>  [6,] 1 0.9999997 0.0005127021 0.0005121175
#>  [7,] 1 0.9999998 0.0002892654 0.0005431666
#>  [8,] 1 0.9999996 0.0002753430 0.0008561776
#>  [9,] 1 0.9999997 0.0006589955 0.0004016151
#> [10,] 1 0.9999998 0.0001285912 0.0005529472


## mirror ball:
jj <- matrix(rnorm(30),10,3)
disco <- sweep(matrix(rnorm(30),10,3),1,sqrt(rowSums(jj^2)),`/`)
p <- as.photon(c(1,0,0))
reflect(p,disco)
#>   E         p_x        p_y         p_z
#> x 1  0.78582711  0.1468142 -0.60076731
#> x 1  0.85990585 -0.4851562 -0.15869895
#> x 1  0.96058840 -0.2282072 -0.15871794
#> x 1  0.77581045 -0.6130671  0.14922103
#> x 1 -0.01596423 -0.7255936 -0.68793825
#> x 1  0.98450100 -0.1570580  0.07804212
#> x 1 -0.89020908  0.4379610 -0.12537123
#> x 1  0.89879332  0.2926319  0.32640032
#> x 1  0.75629556  0.4257562 -0.49673802
#> x 1  0.35629511 -0.8750320 -0.32767789

table(reflect(p,disco)[,2]>0) # should be TRUE with probability sqrt(0.5)
#> 
#> FALSE  TRUE 
#>     2     8 

## relativistic  disco; mirror ball moves at 0.5c:

B <- boost(as.3vel(c(0.5,0,0)))
p |> tcrossprod(B) |> reflect(disco) |> tcrossprod(solve(B))
#>           t          x           y           z
#> x 0.9286090  0.8572181  0.08476320 -0.34685317
#> x 0.9533019  0.9066039 -0.28010509 -0.09162488
